intro: Leucadendron schlechteri, commonly known as the silver leaf leucadendron, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage and conical flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrub form, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and sandy soils.
